title: native docker container image is not created/pushed
body:
### Describe the bug

We want to create a native binary in a container and push the resulting contianer image to our docker registry by using `mvn clean package -Pnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -Dquarkus.container-image.push=true  -Dquarkus.container-image.registry=our.docker.registry:5000 `.
Until version 2.6.1.Final this works fine. Since we updated to version 2.7.1.Final, this command does not create a container image, that contains the native binary. Further, it does not try to push any container image to our registry. It only creates the native binary in the target directory.

### Expected behavior

When executing `mvn clean package -Pnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -Dquarkus.container-image.push=true  -Dquarkus.container-image.registry=our.docker.registry:5000` a native container image gets built and pushed to the docker registry.

### Actual behavior

The container image neither gets built, nor it is tried to push a image to the docker registry.

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux jenkins-slave 5.4.0-96-generic #109-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jan 12 16:49:16 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.13" 

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.7.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.6.3

### Additional information

_No response_
